required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-world Health Outcomes in Canadian Patients Using Semaglutide
clinical_study.official_title: Semaglutide in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes: Real-world Analysis in the Canadian LMC Diabetes Registry: The SPARE Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonists (GLP-1 RA) are an injectable, non-insulin therapy for patients with type 2 diabetes (T2D). Semaglutide (Ozempic®) is the newest GLP-1 RA to become available in Canada in 2018, and is administered subcutaneously once-weekly. In clinical trials, semaglutide has been superior to placebo and other antihyperglycemic agents in HbA1c reduction and body weight loss. However, there is little real-world evidence available on the effectiveness of semaglutide in real-world clinical practice.
To better understand the effectiveness of semaglutide on clinical outcomes in a real-world setting, this retrospective cohort study will use the Canadian LMC Diabetes Registry to examine the effects of semaglutide on glycemic control, body weight, and other clinical outcomes in patients with T2D who initiate once-weekly semaglutide as part of usual clinical care in a diabetes specialist practice group in Canada.

primary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c (%) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.description: Change in body weight (kg) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up
Change in BMI (kg/m2) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up
Change in SBP (mmHg) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up
Change in DBP (mmHg) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up
Change in triglycerides (mmol/L) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up
Change in LDL cholesterol (mmol/L) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up
Change in non-HDL cholesterol (mmol/L) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in eGFR (mL/min/1.73 m2) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up
Change in ALT (U/L) between baseline and last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who report ≥ 1 weekly incidence of any hypoglycemia
secondary_outcome.description: Analyses will also be stratified by sulfonylurea (SU) versus non-SU use, and insulin versus non-insulin use

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who report ≥ 1 yearly incidence of severe hypoglycemia
secondary_outcome.description: Analyses will also be stratified by SU versus non-SU use, and insulin versus non-insulin use

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who achieve HbA1c ≤7.0%
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c will be the last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who achieve HbA1c ≤8.0%
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c will be the last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who achieve HbA1c reduction ≥0.5%
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c will be the last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who achieve HbA1c reduction ≥1.0%
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c will be the last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who achieve weight loss ≥5%
secondary_outcome.description: Weight will be the last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who achieve weight loss ≥10%
secondary_outcome.description: Weight will be the last measured value at 3 to 6 months follow-up

other_outcome.measure: Time to addition of another diabetes therapy
other_outcome.description: Number of weeks until addition of another diabetes therapy

other_outcome.measure: Time to discontinuation of GLP-1 RA therapy
other_outcome.description: Number of weeks until discontinuation of semaglutide therapy in patients who discontinue semaglutide during the follow-up period

other_outcome.measure: Insulin dose at baseline and follow-up
other_outcome.description: Insulin dose will be evaluated in the subgroup of patients using insulin therapy

other_outcome.measure: HbA1c change in low dose therapy and high dose therapy subgroups
other_outcome.description: Low dose therapy (semaglutide 0.5 mg) and full dose therapy (semaglutide 1.0 mg)

other_outcome.measure: Body weight change in low dose therapy and high dose therapy subgroups
other_outcome.description: Low dose therapy (semaglutide 0.5 mg) and full dose therapy (semaglutide 1.0 mg)

other_outcome.measure: HbA1c change in patients who discontinue a dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitor (DPP-4i) at baseline versus simple addition of semaglutide
Body weight change in patients who discontinue a DPP-4i at baseline versus simple addition of semaglutide
HbA1c change in patients who discontinue any diabetes therapy at baseline versus simple addition of semaglutide
Body weight change in patients who discontinue any diabetes therapy at baseline versus simple addition of semaglutide
HbA1c change in insulin users and non-insulin users
other_outcome.description: Based on insulin therapy used at baseline

other_outcome.measure: Weight change in insulin users and non-insulin users
other_outcome.description: Based on insulin therapy used at baseline

other_outcome.measure: HbA1c change in patients who have a 13-week follow-up versus a 26-week follow-up
Weight change in patients who have a 13-week follow-up versus a 26-week follow-up
HbA1c change in patients prescribed semaglutide as second line therapy (excluding insulin use)
other_outcome.description: In the subgroup of patients using one oral diabetes therapy at baseline

other_outcome.measure: Weight change in patients prescribed semaglutide as second line therapy (excluding insulin use)
other_outcome.description: In the subgroup of patients using one other diabetes therapy at baseline

other_outcome.measure: HbA1c change in patients prescribed semaglutide as third line therapy (excluding insulin use)
other_outcome.description: In the subgroup of patients using two oral diabetes therapies at baseline

other_outcome.measure: Weight change in patients prescribed semaglutide as third line therapy (excluding insulin use)
other_outcome.description: In the subgroup of patients using two oral diabetes therapies at baseline

other_outcome.measure: HbA1c change in patients prescribed semaglutide as fourth line therapy (excluding insulin use)
other_outcome.description: In the subgroup of patients using three oral diabetes therapies at baseline

other_outcome.measure: Weight change in patients prescribed semaglutide as fourth line therapy (excluding insulin use)
other_outcome.description: In the subgroup of patients using three oral diabetes therapies at baseline

intervention.description: Prescription for semaglutide as part of usual clinical practice

study_pop.textblock: The study population will be patients with type 2 diabetes who initiate semaglutide between February 1, 2018 and February 1, 2019 as part of usual clinical care, and who are active patients at LMC Diabetes & Endocrinology.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- First prescription for semaglutide between Feb 1 2018 and Feb 1 2019
- Age ≥ 18 years at medication index date
- Clinical diagnosis of type 2 diabetes for greater than six months
- ≥ one HbA1c measurement at baseline and at follow-up
- ≥ one follow-up visit post index date
- Informed consent for medical data to be used for research purposes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of type 1 diabetes
- Recent eGFR <40 ml/min/1.73m2
- Documented history of bariatric surgery
